intro: Prockia septemnervia, commonly known as the seven-veined prockia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with seven prominent veins, giving it its common name. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red and bloom in clusters. Prockia septemnervia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
